operating_mode: 3-Wire CS Mode with Busy Indicator (SDI High)

causality.effect: Device enters CONVERSION state from ACQUISITION state and SDO pin goes to High-Z.
The SDO pin is driven low to indicate the end of the conversion (end of busy state).
A new data bit (D15 down to D0) is driven onto the SDO pin.
causality.condition: After SDO has indicated end-of-conversion by going low.

causality.trigger: The 17th falling edge of SCK or a rising edge on CNV (whichever occurs first)
causality.effect: The SDO pin returns to a High-Z state.

constraints.tHSDO: SDO Hold Time after SCK falling edge
constraints.tDSDO: SDO Data Delay from SCK falling edge
constraints.tDIS: SDO Disable Time after 17th SCK falling edge

states.description: The device is acquiring the analog input signal. This occurs when CNV is low.
The device is converting the acquired analog signal to a digital value. This state is initiated by a rising edge on CNV and lasts for tCONV.
The digital conversion result is shifted out on the SDO pin, synchronized to the SCK clock.
The SDO output driver is disabled (high impedance). This occurs during the CONVERSION phase and after the entire data frame has been read.
The SDO pin is driven low to signal that the conversion is complete and the device is ready for data readout. This occurs between the CONVERSION and DATA READOUT phases.
